resources.string: The Museum of Natural History is a dynamic, evolving organization committed to promoting the understanding and appreciation of the natural world and our place in it.
A meeting place for the arts situated at the heart of a great university
It specializes in interactive exhibits with the goal of helping both children and adults discover the scientist within them
It has a collection of more than 100,000 ancient and medieval artifacts from the civilizations of the Mediterranean and the Near East.
Hill Auditorium is the largest performance venue on the University of Michigan campus, in Ann Arbor, Michigan.
Ann Arbor\'s Michigan Theater combines living history with a singular dedication to the finest film and live entertainment available today.
Wooded park with trails and peony garden
The University of Michigan Matthaei Botanical Gardens (300 acres, 121 hectares) includes botanical gardens, natural areas with trails, and several research-quality habitats.
69-acre park with walkways \u0026 bridges, playgrounds, picnic sites, \u0026 canoeing/kayaking areas.
The city\'s largest park at 161 acres, this hilly green space offers unpaved woodland hiking trails.
Converted into markets and shops in the late 1960s, these historically old buildings have been meticulously maintained to preserve the timeless appeal of their brick and exposed beams.
Briarwood Mall completed an extensive renovation in October 2013.
Entering its 97th season, the Ann Arbor Farmers Market is proud to bring farm-fresh produce to the community every week of the year.
University of Michigan\'s historic 110,000-seat football stadium, known locally as the Big House.
Built in 1923, Yost Field House was the largest indoor building of its kind on any campus in the United States.
It offers inexpensive golf to the masses on a beautifully maintained course.
The Cube boasts three superior skating surfaces, and provides year-round recreation and training for individuals of all ages and skill levels.
